rocks.bastion.core.builder

Interface CallbackBuilder<MODEL>

  • Type Parameters:
    MODEL - The model type currently bound to this Bastion builder
    All Superinterfaces:
    ExecuteRequestBuilder<MODEL>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    AssertionsBuilder<MODEL>, BastionBuilder<MODEL>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BastionBuilderImpl

    public interface CallbackBuilder<MODEL>
extends ExecuteRequestBuilder<MODEL>
    Defines the operations which a user can perform on a Bastion builder before any callbacks have been added to the test. At this point, a user may perform one of the following:
    • thenDo(Callback): Specify a callback function to execute when the response is received and it passes its assertions. We recommend supplying the Callback as a lambda function.
    • ExecuteRequestBuilder.call(): Starts the Bastion test by executing the HTTP request.

    After using the ExecuteRequestBuilder.call() method, the user may obtain the response, for further use in the ongoing test, using methods defined in the PostExecutionBuilder interface.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ExecuteRequestBuilder<? extends MODEL> thenDo(Callback<? super MODEL> callback)
      Attach a callback function to this Bastion test.

      • Methods inherited from interface rocks.bastion.core.builder.ExecuteRequestBuilder

        call

    • Method Detail

      • thenDo

        ExecuteRequestBuilder<? extends MODEL> thenDo(Callback<? super MODEL> callback)
        Attach a callback function to this Bastion test. The callback function will be executed after a response has been received, it has been decoded into a model object and any assertions have passed.

        If this method is not called on the current Bastion builder, then a no-operations callback function which does nothing will be set by default.
        Parameters:
        callback - A callback function to execute after this Bastion test's assertions have passed
        Returns:
        A fluent-builder which will allow you to execute the request and then retrieve the response
